title: CryptoDCA
author: CryptoDCA
content: Hello everyone, ðŸ‘‹I would like to introduce you to our DCA WebApp from CryptoDCA.io. You can use it to buy or sell bitcoin and other coins on existing crypto exchanges using DCA - this comes with a user-friendly interface. In using the app, the coins remain on the exchange (e.g. Kraken) and we cannot withdraw the coins. It also takes advantage of the lower trading fees of the exchanges. We built the product because of:Existing crypto savings plan providers are too expensive.Existing DCA trading bots (e.g. found on Github) are designed for very tech-savvy usersThere is no option to sell via a savings plan as well (an important point to take some profits emotionless)You can also check out our DCA calculator to see the advantages of using the DCA strategies in a visual way!We both have been using the product ourselves for months and would like to invite you to use our app as well, as we are of course very interested in feedback. Currently, the app is in beta status and only works with DCA purchases with Bitcoin or Ethereum and the crypto exchange Kraken.As an incentive for early participation, we are offering 3 months of premium usage after going fully live (There will be a free version of course). If interested, feel free to write me for a personal invite code, read more about the "why" and us, or post here in the forum. I am looking forward for you and some discussion!

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Kraken exchange has an inbuilt exchange feature where one can DCA at their preferred specified time interval. It's known as Recurring buys. Binance (Binance Spot DCA) and many other popular exchanges have the same feature.My question is what advantage does your service (which will have to be paid for in the future) have over the various inbuilt exchange DCA features, which are actually free?

comments.author: CryptoDCA
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on July 19, 2023, 03:03:13 PMKraken exchange has an inbuilt exchange feature where one can DCA at their preferred specified time interval. It's known as Recurring buys. Binance (Binance Spot DCA) and many other popular exchanges have the same feature.My question is what advantage does your service (which will have to be paid for in the future) have over the various inbuilt exchange DCA features, which are actually free?These are some good questions and let me answer them.I tested and reviewed the Recurring Buy feature on Kraken. The feature does not have a competitive fee because it charges you at least a ~1,50% fee, depending on the payment you choose sometimes even more. I know it does not look like this at first.Binance does offer a feature like this - which I have not tested yet. I expect the fee to be pretty high because they only accept debit and credit cards (when using Auto-Buy with national currency). There are other advantages to not using Binance and not leaving your assets on Binance.Reviewing many of those "in-build" auto-buy features on exchanges, I can tell you that they have usually a pretty high fee. For me as a cost-conscious investor, I won't pay more than a 0,5% fee per trade.Â  Â Another advantage will be selling crypto assets with the DCA strategy.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoDCA on July 19, 2023, 03:32:04 PMReviewing many of those "in-build" auto-buy features on exchanges, I can tell you that they have usually a pretty high fee. For me as a cost-conscious investor, I won't pay more than a 0,5% fee per trade.Â  Â So how does "taking advantage of lower trading fees" work? Just need explanation from user side, will it have extra task to support it?Afaik, the trading fees for each platform are static and there will be no changes except to increase the level of verification, or suggest users to alternative payment methods which of course not all users have that.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I liked the UI and spent about 6 minutes adjusting the numbers, you only need to add the night mode and the USDT option with the possibility of merging charts, such as if you invested $100 in Bitcoin and Ethereum, which one is better, and so on. However, I did not find the option to link the crypto API, or is your service to provide advice and notifications, and not real trading through an interface that you provide.In general, the current site is good and I do not advise you to link the crypto API because you will bear the responsibility of executing user orders correctly. You can give users free coins to use after creating the account and offering features paid in bitcoins.

comments.author: MusaMohamed
comments.body: You don't have to make the same but you can get ideas from https://www.blockchaincenter.net/dollar-cost-averaging/ to have tables or charts for comparisons of DCA results from some different cryptocurrencies.One Decade of DCA Bitcoin and its result(SSS) - A Sane and Simple bitcoin Savings planTwo insightful resources to learn about DCA, its potential results and how to DCA when you take profit.

comments.author: CryptoDCA

Because it is in beta status it is running on a separate domain. So if you are interested in using the App as an early user we can send you an invite code or you can subscribe to the newsletter to get one.Nevertheless, we welcome your feedback for our DCA Calculator as well.Â  Let me start, by answering your questions.Quote from: rat03gopoh on July 19, 2023, 03:53:26 PMSo how does "taking advantage of lower trading fees" work? comments.author: risingtide
comments.body: Quote from: yhiaali3 on July 25, 2023, 03:20:15 AMI started using the DCA strategy a while ago but I do it manually because I prefer to use an electrium wallet and a hard wallet.One step beyond a hardware wallet is to run a BTC mining machine. It has a similar mechanism as DCA in that you're harvesting BTC into your wallet at regular intervals in the future regardless of price. Our calculations show BTC mining is a better long-term wealth creation strategy than DCA with the same amount of funds, with the caveat that a mining rig is hard to maintain for most people.

Our app can take advantage of those lower fees.I'm not sure if inbuilt DCA tools are broker though, or is there something I'm missing? So in our opinion, Kraken is one of the more secure ones. If we detect that our DCA App has demand we gonna add more exchanges and features (e.g. withdraw to own wallet). This requires more developer work so we want to be sure that there is demand.Quote from: joniboini on July 27, 2023, 04:58:34 AMQuote from: CryptoDCA on July 23, 2023, 12:06:05 PMUsing a DCA broker usually costs you around 1,5-2% per trade but crypto exchanges usually have a lower trading fee between 0-0,25% (depending on various things). Our app can take advantage of those lower fees.I'm not sure if inbuilt DCA tools are broker though, or is there something I'm missing? Are you referring to exchanges' extra fees when the user uses their DCA tools, not a broker that helps them make DCA trades? What about yours then? Will you charge for each transaction too or you're going to monetize solely on advanced features mentioned on your OP?E.g. coinbase.com charges a fee of 1,5% when executing a trade (Broker service)Coinbase Pro charges a fee of 0,60 when executing a trade (Exchange service)Usually, brokers use this higher fee when executing DCA plans. Also, built-in "brokers" of exchanges charge a higher fee than their standard exchange fee (see the Kraken or Coinbase example above).Right now we plan to have a free plan that executes DCA plans with a low fee for multiple coins. Later on, there will be a premium plan with more advanced features. For our early-access version, I will provide you with 3 invite codes that you could use:BITCOINTALK1BITCOINTALK2BITCOINTALK3If you are interested you could create an account here (https://app.cryptodca.io/sign-up) and use an email address and one of the invite code to use the app.
